• Improved summarization quality using hierarchical and extractive NLP techniques.
Real-Time MERN Chat ApplicationMongoDB, Express, React, Node.js
• Developed a real-time chat application using Socket.IO for live communication.
• Designed MongoDB schemas and implemented encrypted user data storage.
LSTM-Based Portfolio OptimizationPython, LSTM, Machine Learning
• Built an ML-driven portfolio optimization system using LSTM-based volatility forecasting.
• Integrated predictions with Modern Portfolio Theory for dynamic asset allocation.
• Achieved an 18% improvement in Sharpe Ratio over traditional MPT models.
Heart Sound Classification Using CNNsDeep Learning, CNN, Signal Processing
• Developed a CNN-based model to classify normal vs abnormal heart sounds.
• Extracted MFCC and spectrogram features from the PhysioNet PCG dataset.
• Achieved high accuracy in detecting pathological heart conditions.

India 6 Months
• Worked on backend development using Spring and Spring Boot.
• Built MVC-based applications using Thymeleaf.
• Followed enterprise-level coding standards and collaborative workflows.

Backend & Web: FastAPI, React, Node.js, REST APIs
Databases: MongoDB, MySQL

Tools: Git, Postman, MongoDB Compass, Jupyter Notebook, Linux
jd_text:
Dine3D – Job Description (Software Developer)
Company Overview
Dine3D is a technology-driven company specializing in interactive digital solutions, including 3D
menus, smart restaurant systems, and modern web applications for the hospitality industry.
Role Overview
We are looking for a skilled Software Developer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will
work on building scalable web applications, interactive user experiences, and backend services that
power Dine3D’s products.
Key Responsibilities
 Develop and maintain web applications and dashboards
 Build scalable backend APIs and services
 Work with modern frontend frameworks and UI components
 Integrate third-party services and payment gateways
 Collaborate with designers and product teams
 Debug, optimize, and improve application performance
Required Skills
 Strong knowledge of JavaScript / TypeScript
 Experience with React or similar frontend frameworks
 Experience with Node.js / NestJS backend development
 Knowledge of REST APIs and databases
 Familiarity with Git and deployment workflows
Preferred Skills
 Experience with cloud platforms and VPS deployments
 Understanding of 3D, WebGL, or interactive UI concepts
 Experience with Electron or mobile development is a plus
What We Offer
 Opportunity to work on innovative 3D-based products
 Flexible work environment
 Growth-focused and collaborative team culture
 Competitive compensation based on skills and experience
Location
Hybrid / Remote (India)
Company
Dine3D

history.content: Hi Akash, thanks for joining today. I'm Alex, a Senior Software Engineer here at Dine3D. It’s great to connect with you. I was looking over your resume, and you have some really impressive work in the AI and Machine Learning space. I'm curious, what's driving your interest in a Software Developer role like this one at Dine3D, which is heavily focused on web technologies like Node.js and React?

So, hi Alex. Uh, so, I have been uh create in machine learning and AI. I know how to create RAGs and LangGraphs. I have great experience in N8N and uh many workflows. So, yes, I have also experience in Node and React. I have built a lot of apps, including educational apps, uh like restaurant management apps and all that.

Okay, it's good to hear you've worked with the MERN stack and even on relevant applications. Let's dive into that a bit. Looking at your resume, you listed a Real-Time MERN Chat Application. Could you walk me through the architecture of that project, specifically how a message sent from one user's React client gets processed by your Node.js backend and then delivered to the other user's client in real-time?

Yes, I have worked on Mond stacks. So, I have built a chat application for restaurants in which restaurants can chat with each like with each of their clients on like we have made this kind of rack and AI application in which they'll message in their own language. For example, they message us in Hindi. So, they get a response in Hindi itself by the AI of the restaurant dishes or all about the questions that have been asked in by the restaurant.

That AI-powered translation feature sounds interesting. Let's focus on the real-time communication part, as that's very relevant to the interactive experiences we build. Your resume mentions you used Socket.IO. On the Node.js server, how did you handle the real-time message exchange with Socket.IO, and how does that differ from a standard REST API endpoint you might build for, say, user authentication?

Let's focus on the real chat. So I have experience with socket.io. I know how to use like socket.io and all that. I know how to make web sockets and use them with like express and nest. So yes, I have made like if you want to make a authentication, we can also pass the JWT token in for the authentication at the time of socket.io initialization.

Got it, passing a JWT during initialization is a solid way to handle authentication. Let's dig into that process. On the server side, once a client attempts to establish a WebSocket connection and passes that token, what specific steps would your Express application take to verify that token and then persist the user's authenticated state for the duration of that socket's life?

Okay. So, yes, I'd like to tell that like we can we can initialize a session based on the WebSocket past or we can even do like that will be our like that will cause a load, but yes, we can do that that will pass every time the JWT token with the session itself. So, when the when we are passing the message, we are when we are emitting the message, we can pass the JWT token.

Okay, passing the token with each emission is one way to approach it. Let's switch gears to the frontend of that same chat application. On the React side, when a new message arrives from the server via the WebSocket connection, how did you manage the application's state to ensure that this new message was instantly rendered in the UI for the user?
I'm really sorry, but can you end this interview for me because I have to attend a meeting today. So if it be better if you can end the meeting interview for me.
Oh, okay, I understand. In that case, we can certainly wrap up here. Before we go, do you have any final questions for me about the role or Dine3D?

JOB DESCRIPTION:
Dine3D – Job Description (Software Developer)
Company Overview
Dine3D is a technology-driven company specializing in interactive digital solutions, including 3D
menus, smart restaurant systems, and modern web applications for the hospitality industry.
Role Overview
We are looking for a skilled Software Developer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will
work on building scalable web applications, interactive user experiences, and backend services that
power Dine3D’s products.
Key Responsibilities
 Develop and maintain web applications and dashboards
 Build scalable backend APIs and services
 Work with modern frontend frameworks and UI components
 Integrate third-party services and payment gateways
 Collaborate with designers and product teams
 Debug, optimize, and improve application performance
Required Skills
 Strong knowledge of JavaScript / TypeScript
 Experience with React or similar frontend frameworks
 Experience with Node.js / NestJS backend development
 Knowledge of REST APIs and databases
 Familiarity with Git and deployment workflows
Preferred Skills
 Experience with cloud platforms and VPS deployments
 Understanding of 3D, WebGL, or interactive UI concepts
 Experience with Electron or mobile development is a plus
What We Offer
 Opportunity to work on innovative 3D-based products
 Flexible work environment
 Growth-focused and collaborative team culture
 Competitive compensation based on skills and experience
Location
Hybrid / Remote (India)
Company
Dine3D

YOUR INSTRUCTIONS:
1. Act purely as the interviewer. Do NOT output any meta-text like "Here is the interview" or "***".
2. Speak in a natural, conversational, yet professional tone. Avoid robotic phrasing.
3. Start IMMEDIATELY with a warm, brief introduction and your first question.
4. Your goal is to assess if the candidate fits the JD based on their Resume.
5. Ask ONE clear question at a time.
6. If the candidate mentions a project, ask technical details about it that relate to the JD.

Start the interview now. Introduction + First Question only.
